text: Vase Rock is a rock just off Liuqiu Island of Pingtung County, Taiwan. ==Geology== The rock was formed by the rising of the coastal coral reef. Its lower part has been eroded by the sea thus forming a vase-shaped structure. Its highest point stands at a height of . ==Legacy== The Liuqiu township's tourism department ascribes the island's former name "Golden Lion Island" to Vase Rock's supposed resemblance to a lion's head,. although the name actually honors the slaughtered crew of the Dutch ship ', the punitive reprisals for whichparticularly the Liuqiu Island Massacredepopulated the island in the 1630s and 1640s. ==See also== * Geology of Taiwan ==References== Category:Landforms of Pingtung County Category:Rock formations of Taiwan
title: Vase Rock
